title: 106_s2776
content: The "Medical Research Investment Act of 2000" increases the limitation on charitable deduction for contributions for medical research. The "Medical Research Investment Act of 2000" raises the limit on charitable deductions for medical research contributions to 80% of the taxpayer's contribution base for the taxable year. The "Medical Research Investment Act of 2000" increases the limit on charitable deductions for medical research contributions to 80% of the taxpayer's contribution base for the taxable year. Charitable contributions exceeding this limit can be carried over for 10 succeeding years as medical research contributions. Capital gain property contributions are subject to specific rules under subsection (e)(1). The "Medical Research Investment Act of 2000" raises the charitable deduction limit for medical research contributions to 80% of the taxpayer's contribution base. Contributions exceeding this limit can be carried over for 10 years. Capital gain property contributions are subject to specific rules. The "Medical Research Investment Act of 2000" increases the charitable deduction limit for medical research contributions to 80% of the taxpayer's contribution base. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code include changes to sections 170(b)(1)(A), 170(b)(1)(B), 170(b)(1)(C)(i), and 170(b)(1)(D)(i) to accommodate medical research contributions. The amendments made by the "Medical Research Investment Act of 2000" increase the charitable deduction limit for medical research contributions. Contributions made after December 31, 2000, are affected, as well as contributions made before that date to the extent that a deduction would be allowed under the Internal Revenue Code. SEC. 3. Treatment of certain incentive stock options. Treatment of incentive stock options under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include an exception for certain medical research stock transfers. This exception applies to stock traded on an established securities market. The amendment allows for the nonrecognition of certain incentive stock options related to medical research contributions. The amendment allows for the nonrecognition of certain incentive stock options related to medical research contributions, effective for transfers of stock made after the enactment of the Act.
